1125443969393893376.text: Microsoft is now showing Fluid, the new web framework, in action. It's taking components from an app, like a table in Word, sharing component, and someone else can work on it in "real time." Initially will only work with MSFT apps but co insists it will extend to 3rd party.

1125431774245318656.text: Another observation Nadella made during our convo: He believes the tech industry thinks most of the AI engineering talent exists on the US west coast. His belief is that as more businesses create AI teams (using Azure Machine Learning, natch) the talent pool will be much broader.

1125430739728625664.text: When I asked Nadella how he plans to fix those issues, this was his response:pic.twitter.com/EmxIpSy3P6

1125429920526561281.text: It's worth noting that Microsoft's diversity numbers are still worse than Apple, Facebook, Google's, accdg to 2018 diversity reports. And, as has been reported by @nitashatiku, a group of employees recently stood up to Nadella to protest the treatment of women within the company.

1125429479814332416.text: When I asked Nadella about Microsoft's very well-known diversity issues, he told me that the era of the "talented jerk" is over. And that in 2019, if anyone in this industry wants to succeed, they'll have to have an inclusive mindset.

1125428967698157568.text: Nadella is now talking about privacy and security during the #Build2019 keynote; saying privacy is a human right, a phrase Apple CEO Tim Cook has used before.

1125428635966394369.text: Like any tech co that's been in business for decades at this point, Microsoft had had to shift from shrink-wrap to downloaded to subscription software. One way to keep customers coming back is to promise that your software can both identify broken things *and* fix those things.

1125427677496614912.text: Along with some mixed reality applications and AI features. But, as is covered in the story, AI is a loaded topic for Microsoft. It's behind when it comes to AI in productivity apps, but co is really more interested in selling machine learning at scale to enterprise customers.

1125427263468498944.text: A few things Microsoft plans to show off today: 1) A new web framework called Fluid, that's supposed to allow interoperability btw productivity sites and apps 2) New features for Edge on Chromium, the open-source browser MSFT is moving towards 3) Search across all Office 365 apps

1105327346666487810.text: @inafried’s final question: She asks the panelists what they would say or ask Holmes if they had the chance. “Yeah, I think I’d pass,” Shultz says. Gardner says she’d ask her if she wants a black turtleneck to go with her orange jumpsuit

1105324836451082240.text: Gardner says this has been devastating to women. “It is difficult for me to understand...I don’t give her the credit you all do. I think she’s a socialopath — this is my opinion -- and a liar.”

1105324161973415936.text: Holmes tried to model herself after Steve Jobs, Gibney says. But Jobs had learned from failure and surrounded himself with people willing to give him bad news. Holmes didn’t do that.

1105323286177574917.text: Here was a young woman entrepreneur in male-dominated Silicon Valley who represented so much to people, Gibney says, and that turned out to be a fraud. It was “terribly upsetting” to a lot of people.

1105322879896309761.text: Schultz says it was scary, stressful, that he “lost a lot of sleep” during the Theranos saga. Says his mother encouraged him by telling him he was still young and healthy with a good education and “they can’t take that away from you.”

1105322237115064320.text: Gardner on Elizabeth Holmes: “It’s one thing to fail if you’re in the hardware or software business. Medicine? NO...I was angry for many years.”

1098316643258687488.text: The 5G model of the Galaxy S10 has the biggest screen and biggest battery of any S device *ever*. This is likely so you won’t want to throw it out the window when switching between 4G and new 5G networks drains the battery.

1098315908248817664.text: Pricing info on the other products https://twitter.com/tuongh_nguyen/status/1098315015025713152?s=21 …

1098315682968612864.text: For those of you asking, these phones *do* have headphone jacks. (@reckless this PSA is for you.)

1098314859224039424.text: No need to go into pairing mode to pair ear buds with a Samsung tablet. Automatic wireless pairing between devices. Having deja vu from some earlier tech event

1098314177695834112.text: There are new Galaxy ear buds and a Galaxy Watch Active. Samsung also announced another Fit wristband despite market research increasingly pointing to the decline of the activity tracking wristband, with exception of Xiaomi band.

1098312177411227648.text:
Pricing on these new phones, in case you missed it: 
Galaxy S10+ starts at $999
Galaxy S10 $899
Galaxy S10e $749
Galaxy S10 5G TBD

1098311758404415489.text: One thing that’s quite refreshingly missing from this Samsung event - from the last few Samsung events I’d say - is sexist weirdness. Remember the floating ladies at the TV event in Las Vegas? Remember the *S4* event? Oy. This event is very straightforward.

1098310594346663936.text: Okay this feature is wild: the S10 phone itself is a Qi-compatible wireless charging pad. Put phone into PowerShare mode, put it facedown on your nightstand, plop your wireless ear buds down on the phone and they charge.

1098310164640346113.text: Galaxy S10 will run a version of Unity engine for mobile gaming.

1098309818253639680.text: Update: The selfie turned out quite nicelyhttps://twitter.com/thekenyeung/status/1098309280799715329?s=21 …

1098308974686855168.text: Interesting: New Galaxy S10 has an Instagram mode within native camera. Instagram head @mosseri briefly appears on stage to show this off and take an awkward selfie with DJ Koh.

1098308045975707648.text: Just something to keep in mind before you slap a case on the thing and forget about the color until you upgrade three years later

1098307715426729984.text: I should note that the Galaxy S10 also comes in FLAMINGO PINK which was very obvious inspired by Pantone’s color of the year being “Living Coral”

1098306663109451776.text: Camera is improved partly by NPU, the first co-professor of its kind in a Samsung phone. Neural processing units dedicated to AI tasks are all the rage these days, and rightfully so.

1098306295059247104.text: Galaxy S10 now shoots wide angle from TRIPLE LENS rear camera. Scene Optimizer, first rolled out last year in Note 9, gets a couple of feature adds.

1098305259225546752.text: The in-display fingerprint sensor is ULTRASONIC. Reads a 3D image of your finger pad, not just a 2D/optical scan.

1098304926139113472.text: Display in new Galaxy S10 phones has been designed to reduce blue light by 42 percent. (Blue light is the carbohydrate of our modern tech times.)

1098304288525148160.text: Here’s everything you need to know about the four (four!) new Galaxy S10 phone modelshttps://www.wired.com/story/samsung-galaxy-s10-price-specs-release/ …

1098302327306412034.text: Samsung’s DJ Koh says company has “delivered 2 billion Galaxy phones” over the past ten years. But there’s more competition now, he acknowledges.

1098300667431608321.text: $1980 seems so random. Is that supposed to be code for “millennials will LOVE this”

1098300361440342016.text: It will cost $1980! Available on April 26th. The crowd here murmurs at the price. My interpretation is that this is not a positive reaction to price.

1067476947884601344.text: But it's still a weird experience to not be able to manipulate windows very well, throw things on a desktop, or know how an app is going to run. That's the whole loss of control thing with these tablets-as-computers.

1067476506404839424.text: When you tap on an app icon on the Pixel Slate, you don't know if it's going to open in a browser tab, in a separate window, as a mobile app, as a full-screen app, etc. The idea for the future of computing, I suppose, is that this doesn't matter as long as you can get stuff done.

1067476056133627904.text: But (this is in the write-up too) the question is whether these functions are intuitive and, perhaps more importantly, whether you're gaining control or losing it with these kinds of "smart" interfaces.

1067475845931950080.text: And of course, there's a stylus, too. So there are lots of input options. And more notably, lots of ways to interact with apps and tabs and search.

1067475480209571841.text: (Also, I like the round keys on the Pixel Slate Keyboard. Some of you are going to hate round keys. That's fine. Keyboards are a personal thing.)

1067475197207339008.text: The thing about the Pixel Slate is that Google has designed it to be the most adaptable touchscreen UI around. Runs on Chrome OS, supports Android apps, works with voice, has large touch targets in apps like Chrome to make it easy to use. This is all good!
